section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Various connection types are available for using mobile devices in the vehicle. The connection type to select depends on the mobile device and the desired function.

overview.overview-text: Observe when operating systems and devices

warning.paragraph: Operating the integrated information systems and communication devices while driving can distract from surrounding traffic. It is possible to lose control of the vehicle. There is a risk of accident. Only use the systems or devices when the traffic situation allows. As warranted, stop and use the systems and devices while the vehicle is stationary.

Playing music from a USB device.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Personal eSIM is a digital SIM card that is permanently installed in the vehicle.
The Personal eSIM enables making phone calls or the use of mobile data without having a mobile phone in the vehicle.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Depending on the country of registration and mobile network provider, the Personal eSIM may not be available. In this case, a nano SIM card can be used with the BMW SIM reader in order to utilize Personal eSIM in the vehicle. Information on availability can be obtained from the wireless service provider, on the BMW website, or in the BMW app.
The use of the vehicle cell phone antenna improves the call quality and the reception of mobile data.

section.title: Opening/closing the battery cover
section.paragraph: The SIM reader battery cover can be removed, for instance to insert a SIM card.
To open:

action-step.paragraph: Position the provided tool at the opening, arrow 1.
Gently tilt the tool to release the battery cover from the latch.
Remove the battery cover, arrow 2.

section.paragraph: To close:

action-step.paragraph: Place the battery cover on the rear side of the SIM reader, arrow 1.
Press the battery cover down until it engages audibly, arrow 2.

section.title: Inserting the SIM card
section.paragraph: The SIM card slot is located under the battery cover on the underside of the SIM reader. To insert the SIM card, open the SIM reader.

action-step.paragraph: Remove the battery cover.
Insert the SIM card, with its contact surface facing down, into the slot until the SIM card engages.
Close the battery cover.

section.paragraph: After the SIM card has been inserted, the SIM reader is ready for use.

The SIM reader is shown on the control display.

overview.overview-text: Keep out of reach of children

warning.paragraph: Batteries or button cell batteries for battery-operated devices can be swallowed, which leads to serious or fatal injuries within two hours, for example, due to internal burns or chemical burns. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. Keep batteries, button cells, and battery-operated devices out of reach of children. Immediately seek medical help if there is any suspicion that a battery or button cell battery has been swallowed or is located in any part of the body.

Improper batteries in a battery-operated device can damage the device. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Always replace the discharged battery with a battery with the same voltage, the same size and the same specification.

action-step.paragraph: Remove the battery cover.
Lift out the battery, placing the tool on the positive terminal.
First insert the negative terminal of a 3.6 V battery of type ER14250 into the mount, arrow 1. Then press the positive pole into the mount, arrow 2.
Close the battery cover.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Have old batteries disposed of by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop or take them to a collection point.
Dispose of spent batteries according to the regulations of the proper authorities.

Use a flexible adapter cable.
